amendment.description: Amendment sought to specify conditions under which lands in the United States may be nominated for designation as a United States Biosphere Reserve under the Man and the Biosphere Program of the U.N. Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 2 in the Congressional Record of September 25, 1997, to require the participation of each person holding title to lands nominated for designation under the United States Biosphere reserve, or each governmental agency administering lands in the designation process. The amendment would stipulate that land designated as a U.S. Biosphere Reserve shall not carry additional protections or use restrictions.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Brown (CA) amendment (A001) Failed by voice vote.
